paper_abstract: This paper proposes a novel algorithm based on minimizing mutual information for a special case of nonlinear blind Source separation: post-nonlinear blind source separation. A network composed of a set of radial basis function (RBF) networks, a set of multilayer perceptron and a linear network is used as a demixing system to separate sources in post-nonlinear mixtures. The experimental results show that our proposed method is effective. and they also show that the local character of the RBF network's units allows a significant speedup in the training of the system.
paper_title: Nonlinear blind source separation using hybrid neural networks
